FlowGraph
Table of Contents

Class DirectCanvasRenderer

Namespace
FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering
Assembly
FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll

A high-performance graph renderer that draws directly to a DrawingContext, bypassing the Avalonia visual tree for nodes and edges. This is optimized for large graphs (500+ nodes) where per-element Controls are too slow.

Uses GraphRenderModel for all geometry calculations to ensure 100% visual parity with the normal VisualTree renderer.

public class DirectCanvasRenderer : Control, INotifyPropertyChanged, IDataContextProvider, ILogical, IThemeVariantHost, IResourceHost, IResourceNode, IStyleHost, ISetLogicalParent, ISetInheritanceParent, ISupportInitialize, IStyleable, INamed, IInputElement, IDataTemplateHost, ISetterValue, IRenderLayer

Remarks

DirectCanvasRenderer supports custom node rendering via the IDirectNodeRenderer interface. When a node's renderer implements IDirectNodeRenderer, it delegates drawing to that implementation.

Edge endpoint handles are rendered when ShowEdgeEndpointHandles is true and an edge is selected, allowing reconnection/disconnection.

Transform Mode: This renderer uses SelfTransformed mode. It performs its own coordinate transforms internally and MUST be placed in an untransformed container (e.g., RootPanel, not MainCanvas) to avoid double-transformation.

TransformMode

How this layer participates in viewport transformations.

LayerTransformMode

Remarks

DirectCanvasRenderer uses SelfTransformed because it performs its own coordinate transforms internally via ScreenToCanvas(double, double). It MUST be placed outside any transformed container (e.g., as a child of RootPanel, not MainCanvas) to avoid double-transformation bugs.

Point

Remarks

WARNING: For distance calculations with pointer events, prefer using canvas coordinates (via _model.GetPortPosition) since pointer events give canvas coords via e.GetPosition(MainCanvas).

HitTestEdge(double, double)

Performs hit testing to find an edge at the given screen coordinates.

public Edge? HitTestEdge(double screenX, double screenY)

Parameters

screenX double

X coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

screenY double

Y coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

Returns

Edge

The hit edge, or null if no edge was hit.

HitTestEdgeEndpointHandle(double, double)

Performs hit testing to find an edge endpoint handle at the given screen coordinates.

public (Edge edge, bool isSource)? HitTestEdgeEndpointHandle(double screenX, double screenY)

Parameters

screenX double

X coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

screenY double

Y coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

Returns

(Edge edge, bool isSource)?

Tuple of (edge, isSource) or null if no handle hit.

HitTestNode(double, double)

Performs hit testing to find a node at the given screen coordinates. Uses quadtree for O(log N) spatial query instead of linear scan.

public Node? HitTestNode(double screenX, double screenY)

Parameters

screenX double

X coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

screenY double

Y coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

Returns

Node

The hit node, or null if no node was hit.

HitTestPort(double, double)

Performs hit testing to find a port at the given screen coordinates. Uses quadtree range query for O(log N) spatial lookup.

public (Node node, Port port, bool isOutput)? HitTestPort(double screenX, double screenY)

Parameters

screenX double

X coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

screenY double

Y coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

Returns

(Node node, Port port, bool isOutput)?

Tuple of (node, port, isOutput) or null if no port hit.

HitTestShape(double, double)

Hit tests for shapes at the given screen coordinates. Shapes with higher ZIndex are tested first (topmost shapes have priority).

public ShapeElement? HitTestShape(double screenX, double screenY)

Parameters

screenX double

Screen X coordinate.

screenY double

Screen Y coordinate.

Returns

ShapeElement

The hit shape, or null if no shape was hit.

HitTestShapeResizeHandle(double, double)

Performs hit testing to find a shape resize handle at the given screen coordinates. Shape resize handles are shown when a shape is selected and resizable.

public (ShapeElement shape, ResizeHandlePosition position)? HitTestShapeResizeHandle(double screenX, double screenY)

Parameters

screenX double

X coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

screenY double

Y coordinate relative to the root panel (not canvas). Will be converted internally via ScreenToCanvas.

Returns

(ShapeElement shape, ResizeHandlePosition position)?

Tuple of (shape, position) or null if no handle hit.

InvalidateIndex()

Marks the spatial index as dirty, forcing rebuild on next hit test. Call this when nodes are added, removed, or moved.

public void InvalidateIndex()

InvalidatePositions()

Marks the spatial index as dirty due to node position changes. Unlike InvalidateIndex(), this preserves the node lookup dictionary since the nodes themselves haven't changed, only their positions. Call this during dragging operations for better performance.

public void InvalidatePositions()
